intro: Elytranthe vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features daisy-like flowers with yellow petals and a central disk, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Elytranthe vitiensis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal or sandy soils. Its botanical structure includes alternate leaves and a robust root system adapted to its native environment.
